title: Canada's federal government bans WeChat and Kaspersky antivirus on cell phones
originSummary: The statement declares that users use cookies or similar technologies to store non-sensitive information, such as IP addresses, when browsing the web. This data processing method improves the user experience and evaluates the website's audience and social networking features.
With the user's consent, the partner also uses this data to process the device's stored or browsed information, personalize ads and content, and evaluate the success of ads and content.
Another story in the article discusses Canada's ban on WeChat and Kaspersky antivirus software for federal government cell phones, saying the apps pose unacceptable privacy and security risks.
commentSummary: 此文分享了IBM计划收购Salesforce咨询合作伙伴Waeg的计划。此策略旨在推进IBM对混合云和AI能力的关注，同时也会提升公司在欧洲的Salesforce能力。
关于此交易对Waeg员工和客户的影响，文章并未提及。

title: Big V real name system "boots" landing! WeChat, jittery voice, small red book and many other Internet platforms collective official announcement ......
originSummary: Several major Chinese Internet platforms, including WeChat, Shake Tone (TikTok), Xiaohongshu and Baidu, have announced that they will enforce real-name verification for popular self-publishing accounts.

The move comes in response to calls from authorities for stricter regulation of online content, particularly accounts with substantial influence on social and political matters in areas such as finance, education and healthcare.

These platforms gradually prompt accounts, especially those with more than 500,000 followers, to display their real names and relevant verification information. Accounts that are not verified or refuse to display their real names may face restrictions on content distribution and profiting.
commentSummary: 天空和太空全球公司(SAS)已与Cendrawasith制药工业公司签订了一份价值5500万美元的协议。通过这一协议，SAS将为这家印度尼西亚制药公司的产品(包括大麻)的种植，生产和分销提供实时数据。
然而，SAS正在等待股东的批准，以便进行协议。
这次交易引起了业界的高度关注，因为这可能改变大麻行业的数据使用模式和供应链管理方式。

title: Morning Buzz｜WeChat adds new independent send button / Li Jiaqi responds to the lowest price competition / DJI denies being fined 44 billion yuan
originSummary: lululemon launched its "Wunder Puff" jacket line, and Chinese automaker BYD unveiled its new model, the "Song L".
The iPhone Pro 16's camera upgrade and WeChat's standalone send button were mentioned, and rumors of DJI's $44 billion fine were debunked as assumptions.

The co-founder of Google DeepMind predicts a 50 percent chance of achieving artificial general intelligence by 2028, along with news of Apple's new product launches, Huawei's new logo, a response to antitrust allegations, and the passing of the "Friends" actor who played Chandler.

title: WeChat microblogging B station announcement on the same day, will guide the head of the "self-media" account to display real-name information
originSummary: Major Chinese social media platforms such as WeChat, Weibo, Jieyin, B-station and Shutiao have announced plans to direct top "self-publishing" accounts to display their real name information in order to increase the credibility of the accounts and protect the legal rights of users.

This feature is being tested and will be gradually put into operation soon. Accounts with 500,000 or more followers, including domestic and international news as well as specialized areas such as justice and medicine, will gradually be advised to display real name information.
For accounts that comply with this requirement, the platform plans to limit online traffic and revenue for those accounts that are not authenticated.

title: WeChat, Weibo, Jitterbug, Shutterbug Announcement on the same day about "real name display on the foreground" _Account_Media_Information
originSummary: Beijing Daily reported that a number of online platforms, including WeChat, Weibo, Jieyin and Shutiao, had recently announced that they would begin requiring "self-publishing" accounts with a large number of followers (more than one million "fans") to publicly verify their identities.
The initiative is designed to increase the accountability of high-profile accounts by limiting their content distribution and potential revenue if they don't comply with the new rules.

title: Boots on the ground, WeChat, Jitterbug and Weibo self-publishers will "display blogger information under real names"｜Frontline
originSummary: Chinese social media platforms WeChat, Jieyin (TikTok), and Weibo have announced that in an effort to promote transparency, they will require real-name registration for popular users on their platforms.

Specific requirements vary between platforms; for example, WeChat will start with accounts with more than one million followers, while Shake will apply this rule to accounts with more than half a million followers.

In addition, only Jieyin and Weibo accounts dealing with politics, society, finance, education, health and justice are required to display their real names, while WeChat does not specifically designate any type of account. If users refuse to comply, they could face restrictions on their account traffic and revenue.
commentSummary: 本文讨论了全球电动汽车(EV)充电基础设施的快速采用。它强调了开发高效、小巧、低成本的电力电子系统对EV充电基础设施的重要性，以缩短充电时间，增加便利性，提高能源转换效率。
华威大学的研究人员正在研究宽禁带(WBG)半导体如何改进这些系统，早期测试显示出巨大的潜力。WBG半导体能够降低能源转换过程中的损失，促进更高的频率，从而导致更小、更有效且成本更低的能源存储系统。
然而，该文章也强调进一步研究的需要，特别是关于电子磁相互作用与WBG半导体的问题。

title: China responds to Canadian government's cell phone banning WeChat_Mobile Sina.com
originSummary: The Chinese government responded to Canada's ban on the use of WeChat on government smartphones as a classic generalization of the concept of national security, an abuse of state power, and an unwarranted suppression of specific foreign businesses.

The move comes after Canada cited security risks as the reason. Chinese spokesman Wang Wenbin expressed strong opposition to the ban, especially since he believes there is no real evidence to support it.
He urged Canada to abandon its ideological bias, adhere to the principles of market economy and provide a fair, just and non-discriminatory business environment for Chinese enterprises.
commentSummary: 文章讨论了Visa扩展其“Tap to Phone”项目，该项目允许企业将Android智能手机(或任何android设备)转变为支付终端。
Visa原先在30个市场上提供此项服务，但计划在今年全球快速推广，以应对Covid-19大流行期间持续对无接触支付的需求。
此外，Visa希望通过这个项目帮助全球5000万家小企业适应数字经济。

title: After banning TikTok in February, Canadian government device bans WeChat, Kaspersky again
originSummary: France Media World and its partners use cookies or similar technologies to view and store non-sensitive information, such as your IP address. Such data processing helps to improve the user experience, to evaluate the site's audience and social networking features or to assist in personalized advertising.

The partner processes certain data, such as terminal storage or browsing information, advertisements and personalized content, after obtaining the user's consent. Users have the right to change their preferences at any time.
The article also mentions the banning of WeChat and Kaspersky from Canadian government equipment due to privacy and security risks.
commentSummary: 本文讨论了惠普如何改变其可持续性战略，以产生对社会的可持续影响。公司的可持续性目标包括解决当地问题，基于当地伙伴关系，以及关注原始设备制造商(OEM)情境的供应链管理。
惠普还利用技术支持其可持续性努力，通过监测空气和水质，回收电子废物，以及最大限度地减少对自然资源的使用。
其可持续影响投资组合为公司的总业务采购贡献了52%。

title: Canada bans WeChat on government equipment
originSummary: The Nikkei rose 31,481.49 points, or 2.02 percent.
The Hang Seng Index gained 17,119.12 points, or 0.04%; the U.S. 10-year Treasury bond grew by 1/32 of a yield, lifting it by 4.917%; and the price of oil also rose by 81.09 points, or 0.09%.
However, the yen fell 151.27 points, down 0.27 percent, the Dow Jones rose 33,052.87 points, up 0.38 percent, and Canada banned the use of WeChat on government-issued mobile devices.
